content: नश् {vI.v} {c4c} <ab>P.</ab> (नश्पति, ननाश, अनशत्, नंक्ष्यति, नशिष्यति नष्ट; {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} नाशयति; {%<ab>desid.</ab>%} निनंक्षति, निनशिषति) {@--1@} To be lost, to disappear, vanish, become invisible; ध्रुवाणि तस्य नश्यंति <ls>H. 1</ls>; तथा सीमा न नश्यति <ls>Ms. 8. 247</ls>; <ls>Y. 2. 58</ls>; क्षणनष्टदृष्टतिमिरं <ls>Mk. 5. 24.</ls> {@--2@} To be destroyed, to perish, die, be ruined; जीवनाशं ननाश च <ls>Bk. 14. 31</ls>; <ls>Ms. 8. 166</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">7. 40</ls>; <ls>Mu. 6. 8.</ls> {@--3@} To run away, fly away, escape; नश्यंति वृंदानि ददर्श कवींद्रः <ls>Bk. 10. 12</ls>; नेशुश्चित्रा निशाचराः <ls n="Bk.">14. 112</ls>; <ls>Ratn. 2. 3.</ls> {@--4@} To be frustrated, become unsuccess ful. {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} {@--1@} To cause to disappear. {@--2@} To destroy, remove, efface, drive away, cause to fly away. {@--3@} To violate, (as a virgin). {@--4@} To cause to be lost, lose. {@--5@} To forget. {@--6@} To extinguish, put out (as fire). {vII.v} {c1c} <ab>U.</ab> (नशति-ते) <ab>Ved.</ab> {@--1@} To reach, attain. {@--2@} To meet with, find.
नश् {%<ab>f.</ab>%} नशः, --नशनं Destruction, perishing, loss, disappearing.
